name: Ajanta Caves
content: Ajanta Caves are located in Maharashtra and are ancient Buddhist rock-cut caves dating back to the 2nd century BCE. They are famous for their beautiful murals and sculptures.

name: alai_darwaza
content: Alai Darwaza is located in Delhi and was built in 1311 by Alauddin Khilji. It is part of the Qutub Minar complex and is known for its Indo-Islamic architecture.

name: alai_minar
content: Alai Minar is an unfinished tower located in the Qutub complex in Delhi. It was started by Alauddin Khilji and was intended to be taller than Qutub Minar.

name: basilica_of_bom_jesus
content: The Basilica of Bom Jesus is located in Goa and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It contains the mortal remains of St. Francis Xavier.

name: Charar-E-Sharif
content: Charar-e-Sharif is a shrine located in Jammu and Kashmir. It is dedicated to Sheikh Noor-ud-din Noorani, a revered Muslim saint.

name: charminar
content: Charminar is located in Hyderabad and was built in 1591 by Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah. It is one of the most famous landmarks in India.

name: Chhota_Imambara
content: Chhota Imambara is located in Lucknow and was built by Muhammad Ali Shah. It is also known as the Palace of Lights.

name: Ellora Caves
content: Ellora Caves are located in Maharashtra and represent Hindu, Buddhist, and Jain monuments carved into rock. The Kailasa Temple is the most famous structure there.

name: Fatehpur Sikri
content: Fatehpur Sikri is located near Agra and was built by Emperor Akbar in the 16th century. It served as the capital of the Mughal Empire for a short time.

name: Gateway of India
content: Gateway of India is located in Mumbai and was built in 1924 during British rule. It overlooks the Arabian Sea and is a major tourist attraction.

name: golden temple
content: The Golden Temple, also known as Harmandir Sahib, is located in Amritsar. It is the holiest shrine in Sikhism.

name: hawa mahal pics
content: Hawa Mahal is located in Jaipur and was built in 1799 by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh. It is known as the Palace of Winds.

name: Humayun_s Tomb
content: Humayun's Tomb is located in Delhi and was built in 1570. It is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun and inspired the design of the Taj Mahal.

name: India gate pics
content: India Gate is located in New Delhi and was built in 1931 as a war memorial honoring Indian soldiers who died in World War I.

name: iron_pillar
content: The Iron Pillar of Delhi is located in the Qutub complex. It is famous for its rust-resistant composition and dates back to the Gupta period.

name: jamali_kamali_tomb
content: Jamali Kamali Tomb is located in the Mehrauli Archaeological Park in Delhi. It is the tomb of the Sufi saint Jamali and his companion Kamali.

name: Khajuraho
content: Khajuraho temples are located in Madhya Pradesh and are famous for their intricate sculptures and Nagara-style architecture.

name: lotus_temple
content: Lotus Temple is located in New Delhi and is a Bahá'í House of Worship. It is known for its lotus-like architectural design.

name: mysore_palace
content: Mysore Palace is located in Karnataka and is the official residence of the Wadiyar dynasty. It is famous for its grand architecture and lighting.

name: qutub_minar
content: Qutub Minar is located in Delhi and is the tallest brick minaret in the world. It was built in the 12th century.

name: Sun Temple Konark
content: The Sun Temple at Konark is located in Odisha and was built in the 13th century. It is designed in the shape of a massive chariot.

name: tajmahal
content: Taj Mahal is located in Agra, Uttar Pradesh. It was built by Shah Jahan in 1632 and is made of white marble. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: tanjavur temple
content: Tanjavur Temple, also known as Brihadeeswara Temple, is located in Tamil Nadu. It was built by Raja Raja Chola I in the 11th century.

name: victoria memorial
content: Victoria Memorial is located in Kolkata and was built in memory of Queen Victoria. It is made of white marble and houses a museum.
